newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold ends mixed in dormant trade.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold ends mixed in dormant trade.

text.p: Istanbul gold prices ended mixed on Thursday and trade was lacklustre due to meagre demand from the free market, dealers said.
Gold lost $0.65 to end at $387.60 per ounce, but gained 1,200 lira to 1,076,000 lira per gram. Volume dropped by 43 percent to 1,020 kg.
Dealers said trade had been dull on the Istanbul Gold Exchange as demand from the free market had dropped, with most free market dealers having filled their bullion needs yesterday.
There was 865 kg of trade in the morning and 155 kg in the afternoon. Of the total trade, 64 percent was in dollar terms.
